channel.title: Galleries on Nikolai Nekrutenko
channel.description: Recent content in Galleries on Nikolai Nekrutenko

item.title: Adirondacks Adventures
item.description:
Went up to the Adirondacks with the girlfriend for the labor day long weekend. It’s only 2 weeks into the semester and I definitely needed this break.

The hike we went on was called Hurricane mountain and it was absolutely beautiful, definitely recommend it, especially the sketchy firetower up top that clearly is in need of some Loctite.

item.title: Ice Storm Pt. 2
item.description:
I’ve had enough sitting at home, not leaving my neighborhood for a week. So, I ventured out to Jo Hays Vista with my newly built FPV freestyle drone and camera at my side.

Unfortunately I forgot to charge the FPV goggles before hand, so the drone was practically useless. I’m still glad I saw the harsh, wind-chiseled ice.

item.title: Ice Storm
item.description:
A massive ice storm just passed by State College. So while most people were scared of slipping and breaking an arm, I decided to venture out into the neighborhood and nearby golf course with my macro 35mm lens.

I find the texture of the ice fascinating—it resembles a network of plant cells, or looks like some carbonated drink.

item.title: Phone Flashlight Photography
item.description:
It’s been a while since I did something overly creative, like drawing circles with fire. So, here’s a remedy to that!

These were made by leaving the shutter open for a few seconds (30) and using my phone’s flashlight to draw while the sensor gathered light.

item.title: Stonevalley
item.description:
Explored the areas around the frozen Lake Perez—where I used to sail in the summer—one of my favorite places of all time.

I also attempted the tilt-shift effect in Photoshop from a nearby overlook of State College. I think the house turned out the best!

item.title: Snow
item.description:
Happy New Year!

A major snowstorm recently unleashed its wrath on us, for a grand total of 14in or 35cm of fluffy, dry snow!

Here are some of my favorite long exposures from the evening.

Yes, you did notice something slightly different about this gallery. Actually, I probably already converted all of my existing galleries by now, so whatever.

item.title: Snow - Aftermath
item.description:
It was one of those fictional, silent winter mornings

14in or 35cm of fluffy, dry snow had just finished precipitating

item.title: Flying RC Jets!
item.description:
Here are some pictures of my friends over at @teamsketchyfpv flying some of their planes.

Thanks to them for inviting me, I had an absolute blast.

Looks like it’s time for me to get an RC jet!

And yes, we did keep at least six feet apart.

item.title: The Mostly Maine Trip
item.description:
I recently went on a camping/cabining trip with my family around New England, especially Maine.

I know there are a lot of photographs, but I really like all of these.

item.title: Around the Garden
item.description:
I walked around the garden and garage to see what pictures I could take. Here are the ones that I liked:

The thumbnails are significantly darker than the images themselves because I used the wrong color profile. 😢

item.title: Vacuum Tube Amplifier
item.description:
Last night, I was listening to music on a vacuum tube amplifier that I assembled a while back from a kit.

I really liked the look of the tubes in dark, they had a very retro aesthetic. Since they glowed in a very gentle orange-red color, they were perfect for a long exposure.

Maybe it has to do with the look of these tubes, but I’m convinced that music sounds better on tubes than on a transistor amp.

item.title: Water Lilies & Dragonflies
item.description:
Today, I headed down to The Arboretum at Penn State to see what flowers and insects were in store for me.

At first, I decided to bring a 35mm macro lens. However, after seeing all of the dragonflies and lilies, I biked home in record time and snagged a telephoto lens.

I present to you the Water lilies and Dragonflies at The Arboretum at Penn State.

item.title: Solstice Fun
item.description:
I went camping with my family in the beautiful Northern PA countryside, near the finger lakes.

To celebrate the longest day of the year, I found a stick about my height and lit both ends of it on fire. It was similar to the staff that I use in Tang Soo Do, so I messed around with various techniques. Particularly, I really enjoy doing the figure-eight technique where you essentially spin the stick in the shape of an infinity sign.

item.title: Gallerytest
item.description:
Note, I have moved on to a [vastly superior method]](https://github.com/mfg92/hugo-shortcode-gallery)

This is just a test to see how well my python program works.

I wrote a program in python that helps displaying the images about by generating a table in markdown, which is the format that I use to code this website. The images are clickable!
